article.headline: Pepperdine 72, Loyola Marymount 63
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Tyrone Shelley had 17 points and 12 rebounds to lead Pepperdine to a 72-63 victory over Loyola Marymount on Saturday. Rico Tucker and Ryan Holmes each added 15 points for the Pepperdine (10-18, 4-8 West Coast Conference). Holmes went 7-for-8 from the line in the final 2:30 to help the Waves to their third win in four games. Marco Deric and Quentin Turner each scored 12 points for Loyola Marymount. LMU's leading scorer Orlando Johnson missed all nine shots he took and went scoreless for the first time this season. The Lions (5-23, 2-10) dropped their fifth straight and have lost nine of 10. Pepperdine led by as many as 14 points in the first half before Loyola Marymount battled back in the second half. Corey Counts' 3-pointer with 3:32 to play cut Pepperdines lead to 63-58 but the Lions could get no closer. Following Counts' basket, the Waves' defense stiffened and held the Lions to one free throw over the next three minutes. Pepperdine forced 26 LMU turnovers.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
